H0.text: Going dormant is what many plants do in response to days growing shorter in the fall.

H1.text: Turning to liquid is what many plants do in response to days growing shorter in the fall.

H2.text: Migrating is what many plants do in response to the days growing shorter in the fall.

H3.text: Growing faster is what many plants do in response to days growing shorter in the fall.

A4.text: Dormancy can be triggered after a normal growing season by decreasing temperatures, shortened day length, and/or a reduction in rainfall.

A5.text: Many plants and seeds therefore enter dormancy in the autumn.
